results.title: Iran's cine heritage 66
results.brief_description: This CD-rom presents an overview of the Iranian cinema output from the silent era onwards through video clips, soundtracks, artist biographies and posters. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Multimedia PC or compatible with 486 or higher processor, CD-Rom drive, audio board, speakers and SVGA resolution monitor with 256 colors or higher, 8 MB of RAM, at least 10 Mb hard drive space, Windows 95 or later. In Farsi.

results.title: Invitation to social psychology (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Harry From, Stanley Milgram and Harper & Row
results.brief_description: This film introduces the student to the subject by focusing on the subject matter of social psychology, it’s methods of investigation and some of the basic findings. The film looks at a bustling student cafeteria to show how the discipline uses scientific scrutiny. Examines issues such as affiliation, cognitive dissonance, conformity and aggression.

results.title: Invitation to archery
results.creator_credit: Athletic Institute and American Archery Council
results.brief_description: Explores the history of archery and examines modern equipment available. Includes segments on target shooting, field archery, bot hunting and fishing. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Introduction to Yoga
results.brief_description: In this video, especially made for beginners, Laliita Gilbert shows us: breathing, standing exercises, relaxation techniques. This highly instructive video introduces the viewer to the benefits of the essential philosophy and preparatory techniques of yoga.

results.title: Introduction to reaction kinetics
results.brief_description: Illustrates by animation the mechanisms of some simple chemical reactions. Explains the effect of temperature, activation energy, geometry of collision, and catalysis upon the rate of reaction.

results.title: Introduction to gesture drawing
results.brief_description: Gesture drawing is a technique that allows the artist to concentrate on movement, where details are often eliminated. The rhythm and flow of various kinds of movement and the appearance of movement in static objects are shown and then drawn in the gesture technique. The practice of gesture drawing promotes a freedom of expression that will enhance other, more finished kinds of artwork. Includes drawings by Rembrandt, Daumier, Dufy.

results.title: Introduction to drawing materials
results.brief_description: Drawing materials and tools, such as pencils, pen and ink, tempera, watercolor, felt-tip pens and oil pastels have different qualities that can be discovered through experiment. Chalk goes on quickly and easily creating soft, muted effects; brilliantly colored crayons can make a line hard and sharp or soft and blurry. Shows drawings by Degas, Leonardo da Vinci, Cezanne, Van Gogh.

results.title: Equipment
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Instructions on how to clean kitchen equipment; loosen, dissolve and emulsify dirt; rinse and dry equipment; and prevent food poisoning.

results.title: Serving food
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Emphasises principles of food preparation and service in hospitals - proper temperature, correct quality, selection of food to meet patient’s requirements, and courteous attention buy food service personnel.
